industry: Retail Apparel and Fashion, Wholesale, and Wholesale Apparel and Sewing Supplies
description:
We’re looking for a Production Coordinator to support our fabric and import buying team. This role requires an excellent eye for detail, strong negotiation skills, and a keen understanding of the textile and apparel industry. The position is based in Los Angeles, CA.

The ideal candidate for this job is sharply organized, focused on finding solutions, and a great problem-solver.

Job Responsibilities Include:

* Collaborate with Design and Sales to understand fabric requirements and sourcing needs for upcoming collections.
* Negotiate pricing, terms, and contracts with suppliers to ensure favorable terms and competitive pricing.
* Help issue domestic production cuts as needed.
* Monitor inventory levels and manage reordering to maintain optimal stock levels and minimize out-of-stock situations.
* Conduct quality inspections of incoming materials to ensure they meet our standards and specifications.
* Issue Production paperwork - purchase orders, cut tickets, etc.
* Help maintain and update fabric library and inventory.
* Measure and inspect garments for quality; cross-reference with standards.
* Handle send-outs - communicate regularly with vendors and follow-up as needed for information on production & fit samples. Send-outs include, but not limited to elastic shirring, eyelets, tie dye, garment dye & wash, welt pockets.

Candidate Requirements:

* Strong time-management from organization, multi-tasking, and prioritization skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with suppliers and internal stakeholders.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to analyze market data and make data-driven purchasing decisions.
* Detail-oriented with a keen eye for quality and design.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and experience with purchasing software or ERP systems is a plus.
* Passion for fashion and a strong understanding of industry trends and consumer preferences.

Benefits:

* 401k plan with partial company match.
* Comprehensive healthcare, dental, and vision plan.
* Clothing discount.
* Voluntary life insurance, as well as short-term and long-term disability policies.
* Voluntary free annual biometric health test.
* Early access to company sample sales.
* Company-sponsored Wellness program.
* Access to free monthly health & mindfulness webinars.
* Seasonal monetary awards for participation in company Fitness Challenges.
* Partial healthcare-subsidized fitness membership to 10,000 gym locations across the country.
* Company-subsidized discounts to theme parks & local attractions, including Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, Universal Studios, Legoland, Six Flags, Sea World, and Southern California sports teams; discounts to brands including Vitamix, Sonos, and others.
